intro: Stellaria pulvinata, commonly known as the common white stitchwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Stellaria pulvinata thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
